Legal_Issue: Applicability of 'good faith' to sur place refugee claims
Outcome: Original decision set aside, claim referred for redetermination
Legal_Provision: Principles of good faith in refugee claims
Evaluation_Standard: Whether 'good faith' applies when country of origin would persecute for fraudulent claim
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Misunderstanding of legal concept of 'good faith'
Application_Error: Incorrect application of 'good faith' to credibility assessment
Review_Outcome: Decision annulled, matter remitted to new panel
Legal_Standard: Correct interpretation of 'good faith' under Canadian refugee law
Application_Factor: Sur place claim based on religious belief expressed after arrival in Canada
Decision_Outcome: Claim dismissed initially, then decision quashed on judicial review
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Good faith in the context of refugee claims under Canadian law
Cause_of_Refusal: Misinterpretation of 'good faith' affecting credibility analysis
Evidentiary_Issues: No finding of actual fraud; claim of consistent religious belief
Procedural_Fairness: Error in legal reasoning affecting fairness of determination
Credibility_Issues: Credibility challenged due to misapplication of 'good faith'
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to legal interpretation by Refugee Protection Division
Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, principles of refugee protection
Procedural_Issue: Improper linkage of legal concept to factual credibility
Omission_Type: Failure to correctly apply governing legal rule
